turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Overseas Workers Welfare Administration.
turn.1: What is the function of the Overseas Workers Welfare Administration?
turn.2: Overseas Workers Welfare Administration The Overseas Workers Welfare Administration (abbreviated as OWWA) is an agency of the Department of Labor and Employment of the Philippines.
turn.3: What are the services it provides?
turn.4: It protects the interests of Overseas Filipino Workers and their families, providing social security, cultural services and help with employment, remittances and legal matters.
turn.6: It is funded by an obligatory annual contribution from overseas workers and their employers.
turn.8: The agency was founded in 1977 as the Welfare and Training Fund for Overseas Workers.
turn.10: Its head office is at F.B. Harrison Street corner 7th Street in Pasay City, near EDSA Extension, Philippines.
